p:
Yunani or Unani is the term for Parsi‐Arabic traditional medicine as practiced in the Indian subcontinent, and in Muslim culture in central and southern Asia. The term is derived from Arabic Greek and has Hellenistic origin based on teachings of the Greek physicians Hippocrates, Dioscórides, and Galen Unani. It was further developed and enriched by Abu‐Ali Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Amirdovlat, and other medieval physicians and philosophers.
110
